title: Kirk Chambers
text:
Kirk Chambers (born March 19, 1979) is a former <a href="American%20football">American football</a> <a href="offensive%20tackle">offensive tackle</a>. He played <a href="college%20football">college football</a> at <a href="Stanford%20Cardinal%20football">Stanford</a> and was drafted by the <a href="Cleveland%20Browns">Cleveland Browns</a> in the sixth round of the <a href="2004%20NFL%20Draft">2004 NFL Draft</a>. He was also a member of the <a href="Buffalo%20Bills">Buffalo Bills</a>, <a href="Cincinnati%20Bengals">Cincinnati Bengals</a>, <a href="Detroit%20Lions">Detroit Lions</a> and <a href="Atlanta%20Falcons">Atlanta Falcons</a> before becoming a <a href="high%20school%20football">high school football</a> coach in the 2010s.
Early years.
Chambers graduated from <a href="Provo%20High%20School">Provo High School</a> in 1997. For three years he started both on offense and defense. He was a member of championship winning <a href="basketball">basketball</a> teams at Provo High in 1995 and 1997. Chambers also participated in <a href="student%20government">student government</a>, Mr. Provo High, <a href="track%20and%20field">track and field</a>, and the <a href="Chamber%20Choir">Chamber Choir</a>.
A distinguished <a href="high%20school">high school</a> athlete, Chambers was heavily recruited by Stanford University and by his home town school <a href="Brigham%20Young%20University">Brigham Young University</a>, eventually selecting the Cardinal.
Before playing at Stanford, however, Chambers served a two-year church <a href="Missionary%20%28LDS%20Church%29">mission</a> for <a href="the%20Church%20of%20Jesus%20Christ%20of%20Latter-day%20Saints">the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints</a> in <a href="Berlin%2C%20Germany">Berlin, Germany</a>.
College career.
Chambers started all 45 games in which he played for <a href="Stanford%20University">Stanford University</a>.
Professional career.
Cleveland Browns.
Chambers was drafted in the sixth round of the <a href="2004%20NFL%20Draft">2004 NFL Draft</a> by the <a href="Cleveland%20Browns">Cleveland Browns</a>. He spent two seasons with the team, appearing in 21 games with no starts.
Buffalo Bills.
After spending the 2006 season out of football, Chambers signed a free-agent contract with the <a href="Buffalo%20Bills">Buffalo Bills</a> on January 25, 2007. He played in all 32 games for the team over the following two season, starting five.
Chambers re-signed with the Bills in March 2009. He was released during final cuts on September 5, only to be re-signed three days later after <a href="offensive%20tackle">offensive tackle</a> <a href="Langston%20Walker">Langston Walker</a> was released. He was again released during the final cuts on September 4, 2010.
Cincinnati Bengals.
He was signed by the <a href="Cincinnati%20Bengals">Cincinnati Bengals</a> on November 16, 2010.
Detroit Lions.
On August 11, 2011, Chambers signed with the <a href="Detroit%20Lions">Detroit Lions</a>. Chambers was released from the Lions on the final day of cuts.
Atlanta Falcons.
The <a href="Atlanta%20Falcons">Atlanta Falcons</a> signed him on October 25, 2011.
Personal life.
His father was a high school German teacher, so Chambers speaks fluent German. He also earned the rank of <a href="Eagle%20Scout%20%28Boy%20Scouts%20of%20America%29">Eagle Scout</a> while a member in the <a href="Boy%20Scouts%20of%20America">Boy Scouts of America</a>.
He is a member of <a href="The%20Church%20of%20Jesus%20Christ%20of%20Latter-day%20Saints">The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints</a>.
After the <a href="2011%20NFL%20Season">2011 NFL Season</a> Chambers chose to become the head football coach at <a href="Spanish%20Fork%20High%20School">Spanish Fork High School</a> in Spanish Fork, Utah. In April 2015, he resigned as head football coach at <a href="Spanish%20Fork%20High%20School">Spanish Fork High School</a> to become a Co-Athletic Director with Phil Olsen at <a href="Provo%20High%20School">Provo High School</a>.
